title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 57.17 - Requirements for commercial egg-producing poultry flocks suspected of causing human illness caused by salmonella enteritidis acquired from the consumption of eggs or egg products
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 57.17 - Requirements for commercial egg-producing poultry flocks suspected of causing human illness caused by salmonella enteritidis acquired from the consumption of eggs or egg products

State Regulations

Commercial egg-producing poultry flocks suspected of
causing human illness caused by Salmonella enteritidis acquired from the
consumption of eggs or egg products shall be tested, evaluated and managed as
provided in 9 CFR parts
71
and
82. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1
ยง
57.17

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
